question: What is the primary purpose of useEffect() in React?
options: To trigger a function whenever the component is re-rendered
To handle side effects like data fetching, DOM manipulation
To trigger a function whenever the component loaded at first
To trigger a function whenever the component specific state changes

question: Which of the following will cause useEffect() to run every time the component is rendered?
Which of the following will cause useEffect() to run whenever the component loaded at first?
You want useEffect() to run every time ANY state changes. Which option does that?
Which of the following will cause useEffect() to run whenever the component unmount?
What is the return value of useEffect() in React?
You set an interval inside useEffect() but forget to clean it up. What happens in a real app?
options: Multiple intervals keep running after component unmount.
The app becomes slow over time
React will not automatically clean up.

question: What is the role of setInterval()?
options: It executes a function once after a delay
It executes a function repeatedly at specified time intervals
answer: It executes a function repeatedly at specified time intervals

question: What is the role of clearInterval()?
options: It stops a timer started by setInterval()
answer: It stops a timer started by setInterval()

question: How do you correctly start and stop a timer in a React component?
If a parent component re-renders 10 times, how many times will a child component re-render?
Parent component passed props to a child component, how to stop unnecessary re-renders of child?
options: By using useCallback() on the function in the parent component
By using useEffect() in the child component
By using React.memo() in the child component
By setting the props with default value
answer: By using React.memo() in the child component

question: What types of data can be passed as props in React?
options: A primitive data can be passed as props
A function can be passed as props
Object data can be passed as props
Array data can be passed as props

question: What is a callback function?
options: A function that automatically runs when the component mounts.
A function passed as a prop, and its execution is decided by the child
A function that returns another function
A function passed to child as props
answer: A function passed as a prop, and its execution is decided by the child

question: Which is TRUE about useCallback()?
options: It re-create the function when the component is re-render
It should not re-create the function every re-render
It is stop the child component re-render.
The child is re-render only when the props changes.
answer: It should not re-create the function every re-render

question: In a two-way data binding scenario (parent ↔ child), what is typically passed to the child?
options: A copy of the parent’s state.
A callback function to update the parent state.
answer: A callback function to update the parent state.

question: Which of the following is true about React.memo()?
options: It re-create the function when the component is re-render
When the parent is re-render child re-render
It is stop the child component re-render
It is stop the parent component re-render
answer: It is stop the child component re-render

question: Parent wants to update its state when child interacts. What must be passed?
React.memo() will stop child re-render, But when the child is re-render?
Which of the following is not true about React Component Communication?
options: By default One-way communication parent → child
Two-way communication is enable using React.memo()
Two-way communication is enable using callback functions.
The React component will communication using props.
answer: Two-way communication is enable using React.memo()
